Package shellshocker

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Location
    Interface that, when implemented, creates methods that relate to objects on a coordinate plane. These objects will have a position and dimensions.
    Rotatable
    Interface that, when implemented, creates methods that relate to rotating objects in the coordinate plane. These objects will have a position, rotation, and dimensions.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Barrel
    Implements the rotating barrel that is directed by the mouse of the user and can be used to direct the user's attacks.
    Bomb
    Creates a bomb object simulating an explosive device capable of destroying all opponents of the user-controlled character. A bomb has attributes of location and speed.
    Boss
    Creates a boss enemy that guards the final level of the ShellShocker game. The boss enemy differs from other enemies because it has more health, weapons, and cannot be avoidable in order to complete the mission goal in the game.
    Boundary
    Creates boundaries which enemies and the user cannot move through.Boundary objects have attributes of location.
    Box
    Creates box objects. When the user-controlled character comes in contact with a box object, attributes of the box determine the effect, which can be increases in points, health, shield, bombs, fuel, mines, and ammo.
    ControlCentral
    Runs the ShellShocker game by drawing graphics, creating a user-controlled weapon and character control system, and logic system for movement of all items in the game. Called by class TheGame.
    DoorOpener
    Creates an object that links to a door by allowing access when the object is destroyed.
    Doors
    Creates door objects that can be opened by the user to allow access to different areas of the game map.
    ElectricBounds
    Creates objects that the user and enemies cannot pass through. If the user's character makes contact with the objects, health points are lost.
    Enemy
    Creates enemy objects that have patrol areas of the game. The enemies serve the purpose of impeding progress for the user-based character and can be destroyed.
    EnemySprite
    Creates enemy objects that have attributes of location, speed, and health. The enemies serve the purpose of impeding progress for the user-based character and can be destroyed.
    ErrorLogger
    Adds information concerning run-time errors of the game to an error logging file.
    Explosion
    Creates an explosion object that displays a series of images at specific time intervals to imitate an animation of an explosion.
    Flamethrower
    Creates a flamethrower weapon that the user-controlled character can use to damage enemy objects. The flamethrower has attributes of location, size, and rotation.
    HighScore
    Creates a high score statistic. Each high score contains a name and score.
    Mine
    Creates mine objects that can be placed by the user and triggered by enemies to damage them.
    MusicPlayer
    Loads and plays music and sound effects for the ShellShocker game.
    Platforms
    Creates platform objects that the user, enemies, and boxes can exist without falling to areas of the game map. Platform objects have attributes of location.
    Profile
    A profile object that represents each player account. Each profile has statistics of username, password, level, checkpoint, health, and points.
    Ragnar
    User-controlled character that has changing attributes. Attributes include location, speed, direction, and information regarding quantities of weapons, health, shield, and bombs.
    Reactor
    Creates a reactor object that, when destroyed, results in the end of the ShellShocker game.
    ScanIn
    Scans in data from text files to create the objects of the game.
    SmartEnemy
    Creates a smart enemy object that impedes the movement of the user-controlled character. Smart enemies are capable of following the main character.
    StatusTracker
    Creates a status tracker for the user-controlled character. Tracks and displays information such as health, points, shield, ammo, bomb, and fuel.
    TheGame
    Creates an interactive menu system that users will be able to navigate around. The game menu has logins that allow returning users to access their personal accounts. Users who wish to start new profiles may generate accounts using the menu. Interactive tutorials and credits accompany the other features of the menu.
    Tower
    Creates tower objects. The tower objects have attributes of location. The purpose of the tower is the same as that of an enemy: to impede the user-controlled character.
    Weapon
    Creates objects that simulate explosive weapons. Weapons will be able to change location, speed, and direction. Projectiles that the weapons fire include lasers, bullets, shells, and missiles that will inflict damage to enemies and the user-controlled character.
